articles.headline: Senate Passes $280 Billion Industrial Policy Bill to Counter China
articles.snippet: The bipartisan vote reflected a rare consensus in the otherwise polarized Congress in favor of investing federal resources into a broad industrial policy to counter China.
articles.abstract: The bipartisan vote reflected a rare consensus in the otherwise polarized Congress in favor of investing federal resources into a broad industrial policy to counter China.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The Senate on Wednesday passed an expansive $280 billion bill aimed at building up America’s manufacturing and technological edge to counter China, embracing in an overwhelming bipartisan vote the most significant government intervention in industrial policy in decades.

articles.headline: F.T.C. Sues to Block Meta’s Virtual Reality Deal as It Confronts Big Tech
articles.snippet: The move is a potential blow to Meta’s metaverse efforts and signals a shift in how the Federal Trade Commission is approaching tech deals.
articles.abstract: The move is a potential blow to Meta’s metaverse efforts and signals a shift in how the Federal Trade Commission is approaching tech deals.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The Federal Trade Commission on Wednesday filed for an injunction to block Meta, the company formerly known as Facebook, from buying a virtual reality company called Within, potentially limiting the company’s push into the so-called metaverse and signaling a shift in how the agency is approaching tech deals.
articles.byline: By David McCabe and Mike Isaac

articles.headline: With Roe Gone, Republicans Quarrel Over How Far to Push Abortion Bans
articles.snippet: An effort in Indiana to pass an abortion ban with exceptions has exposed rifts among conservatives on how to legislate in a post-Roe world.
articles.abstract: An effort in Indiana to pass an abortion ban with exceptions has exposed rifts among conservatives on how to legislate in a post-Roe world.
articles.lead_paragraph: INDIANAPOLIS — Abortion opponents, especially in conservative states, had hoped to swiftly pass a new wave of restrictions after Roe v. Wade was overturned. But so far, most Republican lawmakers have moved cautiously or done nothing at all, even in statehouses where they hold overwhelming majorities.
articles.byline: By Mitch Smith and Julie Bosman

articles.headline: Spirit Airlines and Frontier call off a proposed merger.
articles.snippet: The decision could improve prospects for Spirit to reach a deal with JetBlue, a suitor it had previously rejected.
articles.abstract: The decision could improve prospects for Spirit to reach a deal with JetBlue, a suitor it had previously rejected.
articles.lead_paragraph: A monthslong effort by Frontier Airlines to acquire Spirit Airlines abruptly ended on Wednesday when the companies called off their proposal, giving new life to a rival bid for Spirit by JetBlue Airways.

articles.headline: Meta reports first revenue decline and a 36 percent profit drop.
articles.snippet: It was the first time the social media giant’s revenue had fallen since it went public a decade ago, as it confronts increased regulatory scrutiny and a turbulent economy.
articles.abstract: It was the first time the social media giant’s revenue had fallen since it went public a decade ago, as it confronts increased regulatory scrutiny and a turbulent economy.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — For years, Facebook’s sales grew without fail and kept on growing, defying the laws of gravity even as the company was battered by scandals over privacy and misinformation.

articles.headline: Manchin, in Reversal, Agrees to Quick Action on Climate and Tax Plan
articles.snippet: The West Virginia Democrat, a holdout on his party’s domestic agenda, said the package would reduce inflation, a concern he had cited in rejecting it just weeks ago.
articles.abstract: The West Virginia Democrat, a holdout on his party’s domestic agenda, said the package would reduce inflation, a concern he had cited in rejecting it just weeks ago.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Senator Joe Manchin III of West Virginia, a key centrist Democrat, announced on Wednesday that he had agreed to include hundreds of billions of dollars for climate and energy programs and tax increases in a package to subsidize health care and lower the cost of prescription drugs, less than two weeks after abruptly upending hopes for such an agreement this summer.
articles.byline: By Emily Cochrane, Jim Tankersley and Lisa Friedman

articles.headline: Federal Reserve Makes Another Supersized Rate Increase to Tame Inflation
articles.snippet: The central bank raised rates by three-quarters of a percentage point and suggested additional large increases could be warranted.
articles.abstract: The central bank raised rates by three-quarters of a percentage point and suggested additional large increases could be warranted.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The Federal Reserve continued its campaign of rapid interest rate increases on Wednesday, pushing up borrowing costs at the fastest pace in decades in an effort to wrestle inflation under control.

articles.headline: U.S. Offers to Swap Russian Arms Dealer for Griner and Whelan
articles.snippet: Secretary of State Antony J. Blinken said he would speak to his Russian counterpart for the first time in months about a “substantial proposal” to free the Americans.
articles.abstract: Secretary of State Antony J. Blinken said he would speak to his Russian counterpart for the first time in months about a “substantial proposal” to free the Americans.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The Biden administration has offered to free the imprisoned Russian arms dealer Viktor Bout to secure the release of Brittney Griner and Paul N. Whelan, two Americans imprisoned in Russia who the State Department says were wrongfully detained, according to a person familiar with the negotiations.
articles.byline: By Michael Crowley, Julian E. Barnes and Ivan Nechepurenko

articles.headline: Crops ‘Stored Everywhere’: Ukraine’s Harvest Piles Up
articles.snippet: Farmers who have lived under the risk of Russian missile attacks have their doubts about an international agreement to ease a blockade on grain shipments through the Black Sea.
articles.abstract: Farmers who have lived under the risk of Russian missile attacks have their doubts about an international agreement to ease a blockade on grain shipments through the Black Sea.
articles.lead_paragraph: A small army of combine harvesters rolled across an endless farm field on a recent afternoon in western Ukraine, kicking dust clouds into the blue sky as the machines gathered in a sea of golden wheat. Mountains of soy and corn will be reaped in coming weeks. It will all add to a 20-million-ton backlog of grain that has been trapped in Ukraine during Russia’s grinding war.
articles.byline: By Liz Alderman and Diego Ibarra Sanchez

articles.headline: U.S. Economy Shows Another Decline, Fanning Recession Fears
articles.snippet: Gross domestic product, in an initial reading, fell 0.2 percent in the second quarter. President Biden said any troubles would be transitory.
articles.abstract: Gross domestic product, in an initial reading, fell 0.2 percent in the second quarter. President Biden said any troubles would be transitory.
articles.lead_paragraph: A key measure of economic output fell for the second straight quarter, raising fears that the United States could be entering a recession — or perhaps that one had already begun.

articles.headline: JetBlue and Spirit announce plan to merge, creating fifth-largest U.S. airline.
articles.snippet: The deal, which values Spirit at $3.8 billion, was announced a day after Frontier’s bid for Spirit fell apart. It is likely to face antitrust scrutiny.
articles.abstract: The deal, which values Spirit at $3.8 billion, was announced a day after Frontier’s bid for Spirit fell apart. It is likely to face antitrust scrutiny.
articles.lead_paragraph: JetBlue Airways reached a deal to buy Spirit Airlines on Thursday, a merger that could reshape the airline industry by putting pressure on the nation’s four dominant carriers.

articles.headline: Pope Francis, Slowed by Aging, Finds Lessons in Frailty
articles.snippet: On a visit to Canada, the pontiff, 85, used his own vulnerability to demand dignity and respect for older people in a world increasingly populated by them.
articles.abstract: On a visit to Canada, the pontiff, 85, used his own vulnerability to demand dignity and respect for older people in a world increasingly populated by them.
articles.lead_paragraph: LAC STE. ANNE, Alberta — When Pope Francis landed in Canada this week, he lumbered out of a car on the tarmac, hobbled with difficulty to an awaiting wheelchair and froze in place as cameras shot at close range the spectacle of an aide adjusting the pontiff’s footrests.
